title: DataViz Makeover 1
description: Explore different perspectives and approaches to design more truthful and enlightening data visualisation.
contents:
1.0 Critique of Visualisation
The original visualisation can be seen below. 
1.1 Clarity
It is hard to compare countries’ performance across six separate charts shared with different scales in y-axis.
For x-axis with title month of period, but we cannot tell each month performance clearly in the charts.
For Japan, there is only a year ‘2020’ at the x-axis, which is not align with other charts.
The title is misleading with ‘top trading’, we do not know the rank of top trading is by export or import or the total amount.
(5)The title as ‘six countries’ but some of them are only regions instead of countries.
In raw data, the trade amount is with unit as ‘thousand dollars’, the chart/title did not mention.
1.2 Aesthetic
The tick line for y-axis is not obvious.
For each chart, there are two y-axes for export and import with different scale, it’ s not possible to put them together to do comparison.
To show the time-serious trend line instead of the area chart which is hard to see the trade amount changing along the time.
There is clear indication of data source stated in the chart.
There is no clear indication of month in the y-axis.
Each chart is too narrow to show the message of monthly data.
The colors of export and import are not distinguished.
2.0 Alternative design

In order to clearly compare difference between 2019 and 2020 and in export and import value and trend chart, 2 individual charts as show in the initial visualization.
All charts with title and subtitle to explain key words and definitions will be showing in graph.
Y-axis are unified to do comparison in the same scale for different years and different trading methods.
3.0 Proposed Visualization
Data Visualization can be found in Tableau Public Server: Dashboard
4.0 Step-by-step Guide
4.1 Data preparation
Select only data for 6 regions, Filter variables = ‘Hongkong, Mainland China, Japan, Malaysia, Taiwan, US’. Select only year 2019-2020 for import and export data sets and paste into a new sheet using Microsoft Excel. 
4.2 Import the two data sets into Tableau.
Connection: Choose Extract to allow them to go public

4.3 The first chart is showing the difference between 2019 and 2020.
To make a pyramid chart for import and export.Left chart as import and right chart as export.
Change the data type for [Year] from number to date&time 
Columns: Put [Export] and [Import] value
Rows: Region 
Color: Year Edit color as opacity 66% 
Edit x- axis, to make two axis (export and import) face to each other, by reversing the scale of export.

To make year 2019 and 2020 stack to each other to compare easily, need to off the stack marks. 
Final look 
4.4 The second chart is showing the trend between 2019 and 2020.

Columns: Region, Month Rows: Sum by month Color: Export or Import

Date change to Month

4.5 Create new dashboard

5.0 Major Observations
Mainland China is one of the major trade partners with Singapore which has largest value among the 6 regions for both export and import in year 2019 and year 2020.
For Malaysia, there is a sharp decline in both import and export in April 2020.From news, Statistician chief Datuk Seri Dr Mohd Uzir Mahidin said the decrease was due to the shutdown of most of the national economic sectors since the enforcement of the Movement Control Order (MCO) on March 18 due to the Covid-19 pandemic. [Sharp decline in Malaysia’s exports | New Straits Times, 2021] (https://www.nst.com.my/business/2020/06/597855/sharp-decline-malaysias-exports)\
There is a sharp decrease in May 2020 for US import value. The declines due to the impact of COVID-19, as many businesses were operating at limited capacity or ceased operations completely, and the movement of travelers across borders was restricted. U.S. International Trade in Goods and Services, May 2020
Taiwan and Hong Kong both import and export are increasing from 2019 to 2020, with a continuous increasing trend.
Hong Kong has the second highest in export value but the last for the import value. The Import value is only about 1/10 of Mainland China.
Japan Import and export value are almost equivalent in 2019 and 2020, which is relatively stable.

title: DataViz Makeover 2
description: Explore different perspectives and approaches to design more truthful and enlightening data visualisation.
contents:
1.0 Critique of Visualisation
The original visualization can be seen below.  The data was retrieved from the Department of Statistics, Singapore (DOS)
1.1 Clarity
There is no title for this graph: not indicating which year and time for this graph, we do not have idea on the purpose of this graph.
There is no unit in both x, y -axis :should be in billion Dollars instead of million ,since the data source indicates “(Thousand Dollars)”.
There is no year to year difference : The information given as “Singapore exports with china since 2009 exceeds with USA since 2006” , but it is not reflecting in the chart, we can not tell year to year difference by this chart.
There is no legend:for the scale of color and size for the bubbles.
1.2 Aesthetic
Overlap problem: There is no transparency of circle, some bubble was blocked by others. Some center points are hidden by other circle/title.
Too colorful in the chart: however, the color separation between net importers and net exporters are not distinct.The color for bubbles also do not have any useful information.
Title of each bubble is misleading: the direction is not consistent and the size of each diaLog box is not aligned .
2.0 Alternative design

In order to clearly compare difference between 2010 to 2020 for each country in net trade value and total trade value and trend chart, 2 individual charts as show in the initial visualization.
All charts with title and captions to explain key words and definitions will be showing in graph.
The value units as been unified by billion Singapore dollars.
For the bubble chart, the Color difference is by net trade value and size difference is by total trade value.
For every bubble, there is a tooltip to indicate net trade value and total trade value and the ranking respectively. In addition, there is a chart shows 10 years changing in the tooltip.
3.0 Proposed Visualization
Data Visualization can be found in Tableau Public Server: Dashboard
Bubble chart
4.0 Step-by-step Guide
4.1 Data preparation
There are 2 .xlsx format sheets:
T1 : Merchandise Imports by Region/Market, Monthly
T2 : Merchandise Exports by Region/Market, Monthly
With variables(country),Date,Export and import value

(3)Drag T1 into the workspace.

Click on the Add|Filter button and then Add.

Select all the 10 Regions that were listed: Mainland China, Malaysia, Hong Kong, Taiwan, United States, Japan, Korea, Indonesia, EU,Thailand
We will see the filter added as shown below. Register the changes by clicking Ok
(5)Pivot the table.
Select all the columns and select Pivot
After Pivot, table shows as below:

The first column format as Date

(7)Filter Date

Select year>>next>
Select 2011-2020
(8)Save the file as Import_T1.csv
(9)Repeat above steps for T2 and Save the file as Export_T2.csv

To make a bubble chart for import and export value.x-axis as import and y-axis as export.

Final chart looks like:

Final look for bubble chart

4.4 Second chart
To monitor the quarterly changes for net trade value and total trade value, I added in a new chart, same as the chart in the tooltip, but add in the quarter in the columns.

4.5 Create new dashboard

5.0 Major Observations
(1)United States of America(USA):
* Total trade amount with the USA is about 19 Billion, increased from 2018 Q1 at 21 Billion to 2020 Q1 at 26 billion , and decreased to 24 billion at Q3 and Q4 2020.
* The Covid-19 pandemic trend up on Q2 2020 which has impact on trading and economic.Second-quarter GDP plunged by worst-ever 32.9% * The USA was top 2 net importer from 2011 to 2019.However,From the 2020 Q2, it turns to be an exporter.From January to June 2020, exports of U.S. goods dropped by almost 25 percent, while imports of goods dropped by about 17 percent
(2)Indonesia:
Indonesia was the second largest Net exporter for Singapore in last ten years. However, the total trade value decreasing from 2010-2016 from 20 bil to 14 bil, then back to 17 bil in 2018, and has a dramatic drop in 2020 Q2 due to covid pandemic.Indonesia’s exports, imports nosedive in May as COVID-19 restrictions hit trade Time to dwell
(3)Malaysia:
Indonesia was the top 2 largest trade partner for Singapore in last ten years.From 2011 Q1 to 2016 Q2, Malaysia was the top 5 net exporter. And almost break even from 2016 Q3 to 2019 Q4. On the contrary,it become net importer in 2020.The largest net imports into Singapore were from Malaysia at 699,000 tonnes
(4)Hong Kong:
Hong kong was the top exporter for Singapore in last ten years.Even during the covid pandemic period in 2020 Q2 , the trade value was about the same as in 2019 and reverted back from Q2 to Q4. Hong Kong mainly exported machines, precious metals and transportation facilities to Singapore
